history.content:
There is no right answer. It depends on how interested you are in AI/ML over other fields.

For your 5 slots, I'd strongly suggest 170 and 189 (provided you've taken classes from other departments in preparation), and pick 3 out of 186 (if you're interested in a data-centric industry) / 161 (if you're interested in security or cryptography) / 162 (low-level systems programming) / 100 (data science) and 188.

You could definitely look at other courses too (graphics, UI, etc.), again depending on your interests, but I feel the above courses are among the most popular and would be adequate for your degree.

children.subject: I'm set on taking 188, 161, 162, 170, 189 as my five upper divs if that helps at all. I think these give a good balance of theory/ML and application to industry.

Is CS 188 worth it?
I was wondering if the class is considered a really worthwhile experience or if my time would be better in another tech?

history.content: If I am only able to take 5 CS upper divs during my time at Berkeley, is CS 188 a good use of those 5 slots?
history.subject: Is 188 worth it?
